perturbation.original_text: 10.1. Taxes. Each Party shall be responsible for taxes that should be borne by it in accordance with applicable Law. If any Party pays any taxes that should have been borne by the other Party in accordance with Law, such other Party shall reimburse such Party within seven (7) days after its receipt of documentation evidencing such tax payment so incurred by such Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1. Taxes. Each Party shall be responsible for taxes that should be borne by it in accordance with applicable Law. If any Party pays any taxes that should have been borne by the other Party in accordance with Law, such other Party shall reimburse such Party within thirty (30) days after its receipt of documentation evidencing such tax payment so incurred by such Party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a reimbursement period of seven (7) days for taxes paid on behalf of the other party. The modified text changes this period to thirty (30) days, creating a direct contradiction regarding the time frame for tax reimbursement.

perturbation.original_text:
6.6. Effect of Termination. 
(a) Upon termination (but not expiration) of this Agreement for any reason, Licensee shall be entitled to use the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content for a limited period of time, not to exceed ninety (90) days, during which it shall diligently work to transition to another solution. 
6.7. Survival. The duties and obligations of the Parties under Articles IV, VI, VIII, IX and X and Section 7.2 of this Agreement shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.6. Effect of Termination. 
(a) Upon termination (but not expiration) of this Agreement for any reason, Licensee shall be entitled to use the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content for a limited period of time, not to exceed thirty (30) days, during which it shall diligently work to transition to another solution. 
6.7. Survival. The duties and obligations of the Parties under Articles IV, VI, VIII, IX and X and Section 7.2 of this Agreement shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Section 6.6(a) initially states a 90-day transition period post-termination for the Licensee to use licensed materials. The modified text shortens this to 30 days, creating a contradiction about the duration of the transition period, thus impacting obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
10.3. Notices. All notices, requests, claims, demands and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed duly given, made or received (i) on the date of delivery if delivered in person or by messenger service, (ii) on the date of confirmation of receipt of transmission by facsimile (or, the first (1st) Business Day following such receipt if (a) such 
date of confirmation is not a Business Day or (b) confirmation of receipt is given after 5:00 p.m., Beijing time) or (iii) on the date of confirmation of 
receipt if delivered by an internationally recognized overnight courier service or registered or certified mail (or, the first (1st) Business Day 
following such receipt if (a) such date of confirmation is not a Business Day or (b) confirmation of receipt is given after 5:00 p.m., Beijing time) to 
the respective parties hereto at the following addresses (or at such other address for a party as shall be specified in a notice given in accordance 
with this Section 10.3):
perturbation.changed_text:
10.3. Notices. All notices, requests, claims, demands and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed duly given, made or received (i) on the date of delivery if delivered in person or by messenger service, (ii) three (3) days after the date of confirmation of receipt of transmission by facsimile (or, the first (1st) Business Day following such receipt if (a) such 
date of confirmation is not a Business Day or (b) confirmation of receipt is given after 5:00 p.m., Beijing time) or (iii) five (5) days after the date of confirmation of 
receipt if delivered by an internationally recognized overnight courier service or registered or certified mail (or, the first (1st) Business Day 
following such receipt if (a) such date of confirmation is not a Business Day or (b) confirmation of receipt is given after 5:00 p.m., Beijing time) to 
the respective parties hereto at the following addresses (or at such other address for a party as shall be specified in a notice given in accordance 
with this Section 10.3):
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that notices are deemed received on the 'date of confirmation' for methods (ii) and (iii). The modified text changes this, adding delays of three (3) days for facsimile and five (5) days for courier/mail. This directly contradicts the original 'date of confirmation' timeline, affecting when contractual obligations are triggered by notices.
